If $ f(x)=3x+2$ for all real $ x$, then the statement:\\
"$ |f(x)+4| < a$ whenever $ |x+2| < b$ and $ a>0$ and $ b>0$"\\
is true when\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ b \le a/3
\qquad \textbf{(B)}\ b > a/3
\qquad \textbf{(C)}\ a \le b/3
\qquad \textbf{(D)}\ a > b/3 \\
\qquad \textbf{(E)}\ \text{The statement is never true.}$
